[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Index Manipulation] Can corrupted index values cause get_event_by_version_and_index calls to read wrong events or panic, breaking event stream consistency checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [BigEndian Decoding Attack] Can an attacker exploit read_u64::<BigEndian> to inject malicious version/index values by corrupting the database with carefully crafted byte sequences? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Concurrent Read Corruption] During database writes, can concurrent decode_value reads observe partial writes (torn reads) that produce invalid version/index pairs despite atomic write guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Line: 24] [Macro Expansion] Does the define_pub_schema! macro properly validate that EventByKeySchema uses correct CF_NAME (EVENT_BY_KEY_CF_NAME), or can misconfiguration cause events to be written to wrong column families? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Lines: 26-30] [Type Alias Confusion] Can type aliases for Key and Value cause confusion where (EventKey, SeqNum) is accidentally swapped with (Version, Index) in calling code, leading to database corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Line: 27] [Key Tuple Order] Is the tuple order (EventKey, SeqNum) consistently maintained across all write paths, or can code accidentally write (SeqNum, EventKey) causing key ordering violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Line: 30] [Value Tuple Semantics] Can the (Version, Index) value tuple be misinterpreted where Index refers to event position within a transaction, leading to off-by-one errors or incorrect event retrieval? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Duplicate Key Attack] Can concurrent writes to EventByKeySchema with identical (EventKey, seq_num) keys from different transactions overwrite each other, causing event loss or inconsistent indices? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Sequence Number Gap] Can missing sequence numbers in the event stream (e.g., seq_num jumps from 5 to 7) cause lookup_events_by_key to fail with 'Sequence number not continuous' errors at line 137 of event_store.rs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Version Rollback Attack] Can a malicious validator write events with version values lower than the current ledger version, causing historical event data to be overwritten and breaking audit trails? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Index Collision] Can two events in the same transaction have the same index value, causing one event to be lost when both are written to EventByKeySchema? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Cross-Schema Inconsistency] Can EventByKeySchema and EventByVersionSchema become inconsistent where an event exists in one index but not the other, breaking event queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Pruning Race Condition] During event pruning operations that delete entries from EventByKeySchema, can concurrent reads observe partial deletions causing 'DB corruption' errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Overall Schema] [Orphaned Index Entries] Can events be deleted from EventSchema without removing corresponding EventByKeySchema entries, creating orphaned indices that point to non-existent events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Key Type] [EventKey Collision] Can two different EventKey instances (different creation_number or account_address) produce identical to_bytes() output due to BCS encoding collisions, allowing attackers to overwrite other users' event indices? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Key Type] [EventKey Forgery] Can an attacker craft an EventKey with account_address set to a privileged account (like 0x1 for system events) to inject malicious events into system event streams? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Key Type] [Creation Number Manipulation] Can incrementing creation_number beyond safe limits cause EventKey.to_bytes() to produce keys that conflict with other event streams, leading to cross-stream contamination? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Key Type] [Zero EventKey Attack] Can an attacker use EventKey::new(0, AccountAddress::ZERO) to cause conflicts with uninitialized or special system event keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Key Type] [EventKey Size Assumption] The code assumes EventKey serialization is EVENT_KEY_LEN bytes, but can BCS versioning or future EventKey fields break this assumption causing decode failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [SeqNum Type] [Sequence Number Wraparound] When seq_num reaches u64::MAX, what prevents the next event from using seq_num = 0, potentially overwriting the first event in the stream and corrupting historical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [SeqNum Type] [Sequence Number Gaps] Can transaction failures or partial block execution create gaps in sequence numbers, breaking the continuity assumption enforced by lookup_events_by_key? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [SeqNum Type] [Negative Sequence Number] Although seq_num is u64, can integer underflow in calling code pass very large u64 values that appear as 'negative' sequence numbers when interpreted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [SeqNum Type] [Sequence Number Reuse Attack] Can a malicious smart contract emit events with manually-controlled sequence numbers that conflict with automatically-incremented sequence numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [SeqNum Type] [Out-of-Order Writes] Can concurrent transaction processing write events with non-monotonic sequence numbers to EventByKeySchema, violating ordering expectations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Value Fields] [Version Spoofing] Can an attacker write events with version values from the future (> current ledger version), causing time-travel attacks or breaking ledger_version bounds checks in queries? (Critical)
